title: Terminus
dialogue_triumphs: Bor discovers he isn't dead. 'It's a relief. I am hoping for something rather better on the other side.'
dialogue_disasters: The Black Guardian tells Turlough how to disable the TARDIS: 'Operate the blue switches!'

continuity_notes.name: Terminus
continuity_notes.description: A spacecraft at the centre of the known universe, once capable of time travel.
continuity_notes.current_status: Serving as a leper colony and medical facility for Lazar's disease.

continuity_notes.name: Event One
continuity_notes.description: A cosmic event caused by the explosion of a jettisoned fuel pod from Terminus in a void, leading to a chain reaction.

continuity_notes.name: TARDIS Space-Time Element
continuity_notes.description: A crucial component of the TARDIS located beneath the console, referred to as 'the heart of the TARDIS'.
continuity_notes.current_status: When removed in flight, it causes dimensional instability and potential TARDIS break-up.

continuity_notes.name: Lazar's Disease
continuity_notes.description: A disease curable by a massive dose of radiation, though this method is crude and potentially dangerous.

continuity_notes.name: Nyssa
continuity_notes.description: A companion of the Doctor from Traken with scientific knowledge.
continuity_notes.current_status: Decides to stay on Terminus to help synthesize hydromel and aid the sick.

continuity_notes.name: Hydromel
continuity_notes.description: A drug supplied by Terminus Incorporated to treat Lazar's disease.

technobabble: The TARDIS failsafe seeks out and locks onto the nearest spacecraft when impending break-up occurs.
roots: Papillon (a leper colony as sanctuary for convicts)

Norse mythology (Valgard, Eirak, Sigurd, Bor, the Garm)
links: Turlough is given Adric's room in the TARDIS

additional_notes: Once remembered for Nyssa dropping her skirt and the rumoured appearance of the Ice Warriors that didn't happen.
bottom_line: 'There is no return. This is Terminus.' Once remembered for all the wrong reasons, 'Terminus' has matured and now stands revealed as an excellent example of pure, technobabble-free SF within the series' format. Nyssa's farewell with the Doctor ('You're a very brave person') is one of the series' most emotional moments.
